Orders_For_Discipline_and_Treatments.cSInt_rscomments: Patient demonstrates understanding of safety measures and medication management
Orders_For_Discipline_and_Treatments.cSInt_assessment:
The patient is a 54-year-old, English-speaking, Caucasian male who lives at home with his wife and family. Start of Care visit done today.

Primary Diagnosis: STEMI with complications including post MI cardiac papillary muscle rupture

Past Medical History: Hyperlipidemia, Ventricular tachycardia, Multiple colon polyps, Gastritis, Duodenitis

Homebound Reasons: Cardiac debility following STEMI and cardiac surgery, requires assistance with mobility and ADLs, uses 4WW for ambulation

Home Health is required for: patient/caregiver teaching/training of disease process, medication management, and safety

Disciplines ordered: SN, OT, MSW, ST evaluations scheduled
Orders_For_Discipline_and_Treatments.cSInt_nvisitplans: Continue POC, medication reconciliation, cardiac status monitoring

Skilled_Intervention.skilledInterventionAsses: Upon arrival, the patient was assessed in their home environment. Vital signs were obtained with the following results: heart rate 104 bpm, blood pressure 113/79 mmHg (left upper extremity, sitting), oxygen saturation 96% on room air, and temperature 97.5Ã‚Â°F (temporal). Patient's weight was documented at 196.6 pounds. The chest wound was assessed and found to be clean, dry, and intact. Patient reported last bowel movement yesterday and denied any medication changes. Patient has an upcoming cardiac appointment scheduled for tomorrow. Education was provided regarding dehydration prevention and management in elderly patients, including signs, symptoms, and complications. Additional teaching was conducted on edema control and prevention, covering causes, symptoms, and management strategies including leg elevation, proper hygiene, and safe ambulation techniques. The patient tolerated the visit well with no signs of distress noted.
